Reviews.Title: Love the size but not the perfect all around camera
Reviews.Author: J. Fox "Jolando"
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a camera that does it all, this might not be the camera for you. If you're looking for a low budget, beginner or second camera with features and zoom in a compact size, I would definitely recommend this one, as long as you know its limitations.To the positive. This is definitely a pocket compact: small, weighing just 5.5 oz, it slips easily into purse or pocket. It's also a fast P&S.; The focusing is extremely fast and the shutter response is quite acceptable. The printed results without editing and taken outdoors in sunlight are sharp when printed in 8.5x11 size, although the colors seem pushed a bit rather than natural. However, I didn't find that to be unpleasing and the photo can always be toned down in a photo editing program.Another plus  is the camera shoots HD video, but a computer program like Picasa, which will show the video, shows it in very poor quality and resolution.This camera is very much a P&S.; If you're looking for simplicity, it fits the bill. The anti-shake feature is negligent. The printed instruction manual tells you to hold the camera steady with your elbows pressed to your sides to take the picture. Not an encouragement for macro or low light, hand held photography. However, the zoom does go out to a full 10x optical with good results in bright sun. I haven't tried it on a rainy or overcast day yet, but did try shooting in the direction of the sun with good results and no noticeable purple fringing.Indoors with flash is acceptable. The flash distance is 1.6 feet. Any closer than that, the flash does go off, but it gets the shadow of the lens in the lower right corner.Most of the features such as sunset, beach, snow, etc. are built into the F1 setting on the top wheel and through the menu system. The camera has face detection and flesh colors come out fairly well.I've only had the camera a day. I bought it as a second camera because I wanted a 10x or better zoom in a pocket camera I could take along everywhere, including bicycle rides. For $200, this fit in my plans. I have other cameras I can use for macros and hand held night shots. This site, [...] has a more detailed review of the camera features.Fujifilm FinePix JZ300 12 MP Digital Camera with 10x Wide Angle Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)

Reviews.Title: Great, does everything youneed it to!!!
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Hannah Merchant "Happy Hannah"
Reviews.Content: I had purchased the Kodak Z915 from Target and even though the price was nice $149.99 when I got the camera home I was so disappointed with the quility of the indoor pictures I just knew I had to return it.Thankfully Targets returns policy is AMAZING and the returned it no questions asked.My last camera was a Fujifilm camera, it was a big bulky camera which I was happy with but really wanted a smaller camera as it broke due to carrying it around in my purse and it geting knocked around to much.After having the Kodak for about about a week and becoming very disappointed with the picture quality I know I have to go back to Fuji film as I had always had great comments on the photos I took on my old Fujifil camera.Anyway, I chose this camera (Fujifilm JZ300)as it was nice and compact but still had the 10x zoom (which is great for such a small camera) 12mps, which gives great crisp pics and also has the HD video (which is AMAZING btw - and I also don't have to convert it on my PC and can put it straight on DVD......Sweet!!!)The picture quilty is great and although indoors is never as good as outdorrs its still great and I am so happy I upgraded to this camera.You really won't be disappointed with this camera as it does everything you need it to and more.I love the pictures I take, the featuresare easy to use and I like the fact you can take black and white and sepia etc.I hope this review has helped and you enjoy the camera as much as I do.:-)

Reviews.Title: Pauls review
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: The auto mode indoors seems to be inconsistent in low light. The neat thing with this camera is the dial has sp1 and sp2 you can program from 13 different programs. I had good luck using the nighttime mode indoors in lower light and the colors and contrast seem more accurate. The dial has a scene recognition auto mode and a auto mode, again using it indoors seemed pretty inconsistent in lower light. I don't consider this camera a beginner camera just because of the program functions. The zoom is amazing, like most cameras at high magnification must be held still to get a sharp picture. Don't know if it has a stablization program, seems like it doesn't. The dial has 8 functions; natural flash, natural, scene recognition auto, auto, program, sp1, sp2, video. It doesn't have a AV mode for the more advanced user. Although iso can be set all the way down to 3200. This camera was a replacement for my Fuji F30 and it surpasses it everyway. The F30 was friendlier to use indoor. Blew some of the pictures up I took at full zoom and was amazed how they stayed sharp. Video I haven't used much, its sharp, also the zoom can be used in video. If your having problems in the auto mode try one of the program modes and I'm sure you'll find something to work. This pocket camera has alot of features for someone who likes to have the ability to adjust for the conditions the camera is being used. One more thing helps the focus from hunting is I'll push the shutter button half way on the image I want in focus on then frame the picture and it holds it pretty good, even if I release the button. So if your looking for a simple point and shoot this isn't it. Pick the right program and it will blow away the other point and shoots.

Reviews.Title: updated 9-20-10 so-so videos, but indoor photos not good at all
Reviews.Author: violinmom
Reviews.Content: I am not pleased at all with this camera. I bought it to replace an older Fuji camera. That one took great photos, inside and out, but it only took 1 minute long videos. So I decided to get another Fuji camera and this new one takes much longer videos. I assumed the photo quality would be the same, if not better, than the older Fuji camera I own. I was SO WRONG.No matter what setting I use I get grainy indoor photos. At times, if I'm sitting close to the object, I will get a good photo. But typically the photos come out grainy. I even use the setting where it takes two photos back to back, one with flash, the other without, and still both photos will be grainy.I am not happy AT ALL with this camera. Yes, I get longer videos, but I have to carry both cameras with me when I visit the grandkids. The old Fuji camera to take still shots. And this new Fuji camera to take videos. Kind of a hassle, taking both cameras, but I can't get good still shots with this new Fuji camera.UPDATE 9-20-2010Ended up replacing this camera with a Canon (PowerShot SD1400IS, which I love so far). At first I had decided to keep the Fuji JZ300 to take videos, since it seemed to do a decent job. But the Fuji has this sound sensor which turns off the recording of sound if the camera doesn't pick up any noise. This turned out to be a real problem! It would not start recording sound quick enough, so you missed the first two or three words a person said! There would be complete silence during playback, and then you'd see the person in the video start to talk, and then the camera would start back up recording the sound. Very frustrating! Also, I got tired of hearing the camera itself zooming in and out during the taking of videos. In the middle of filming something you'd go to zoom in during a critical moment, and you'd hear "zzzzzzzzzzip" Zoom back out and again you'd hear "zzzzzzzzip". You would hear this while filming AND during playback, so of course you'd miss any of the conversation or sound you were wanting to record. My new Canon has a digital zoom that is silent, both while filming and during playback. I can't believe I lived with this Fuji JZ300 so long, now that I know something much better is out there. My husband gave me this Canon camera this past weekend for my birthday (probably because he got tired of me complaining about this Fuji JZ300 so much!). :-)

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Dave Lansing
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_moHGK3DHDE29RK', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_moHGK3DHDE29RKloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } } } Length:: 0:27 MinsSample HD movie taken in Las Vegas using this camera. Amazing quality for the money.Fuji packs 12 MP with 10x zoom into a point and shoot with HD movie mode. The night pictures are second to none, even without a tripod. You cannot go wrong by purchasing this camera.Fujifilm FinePix JZ300 12 MP Digital Camera with 10x Wide Angle Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Black)

Reviews.Title: Disappointing indoor photo quality!
Reviews.Author: manala23
Reviews.Content: I was expecting so much more from a Fuji!  The photo quality was a huge disappointment.  Outdoor photos were average.  Indoor pictures were terrible..grainy, mottled, dull color and not crisp.  The only setting that I could get good pictures in was the 10x zoom,  or the macro!  Also, good video.  If you are looking for a camera that will take easy, quick snapshots on an auto setting that produces clear, crisp shots...this is NOT it!  Also, the dial that you select the mode with turns very easily, and would not stay on the mode I set it on.  The face recognition feature was not very effective...if the subjects have on glasses or a hat, or have long hair, it often will not work.  I returned it, and replaced it with a Nikon Coolpix s8000...NO comparison!  The Nikon is great...easy to use,  clear crisp pictures every time!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Outdoor Camera
Reviews.Author: Jerry R. South "Photo fan"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes fantastic outdoor shots.  I just returned from a family easter egg hunt with my kids and several of their cousins and the shots using the 10X zoom were great.  Quick recovery time between shots and only a few out of 150 shots were out of focus.  Somewhat disappointing for indoor shots using the automatic setting although I did not try the scene selection options for indoor phoy\tos.  The flash seemed only effective 5 to 6 feet.  I also own a panasonic lumix camera that I am very happy with but I wanted more zoom capability

Reviews.Title: Great size, but that's about it.
Reviews.Author: Armando N. Roman
Reviews.Content: My Samsung L100 died last week, and despite being over a year old and "just" 8.2 MP, it was a great camera. I got this Fujifilm JZ300 as a replacement, and I can't believe how much worse it is in every department aside from size, compared to the Samsung. I'm no professional photographer, or even a photography student by any means, but I have an eye for detail, and there's no way you can convince me that this is a real 12 MP camera with HD video capabilities.I've went through all the settings on this thing after taking a few pictures to make sure it was set to 12 MP, and sure enough, it was. Then I set the quality from normal to fine, and it honestly didn't make a difference. If anything, it made the file size bigger and that's it. So what's so bad about the image quality? I'll put a picture up in the customer images for you to see. Everything is grainy. At first I thought that it might just be that the images look better when you view them in a larger size, but they looked worse. Even my old Canon Powershot from 2005, a 4 MP camera, put out better quality images than this. As for the video quality, that's grainy too. I will say one positive thing about it though- the audio for video on this camera -is- better than the Samsung's. Everything is nice and clear and loud with this JZ300. But really, is audio as important as video when going over features on a camera that's supposed to be HD?Don't even get me started on the other features of the camera, like face detection, the smoothing option and even my beloved Macro, which I'll admit- I use for damn-near everything. If I had to say anything else nice, and I'm really grasping here, it's that you really can just point and shoot without waiting a second or two for the image to stabilize. That and the audio for video are the only pros aside from the size/weight.What else can I say? I'm severely disappointed by this thing and will be exchanging it for a different model. Ten bucks says that I can get one for a lot less that has better quality, regardless of features.

Reviews.Title: A Small Camera That Gets the Job Done
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: OK, I've read the reviews on this camera in Consumer Reports and on-line.  It gets middle of the road scores but you have to ask yourself this:  what do I want in a compact camera?I find the size of the camera very convenient but the features are excellent.  The zoom is great and the video is crisp.  The flash photos do come out a bit dark...I'll say that much, but shooting pictures using ambient lighting, even at night, works very well.This is not a top of the line professional camera.  It is what it.  It's a handy, easy-to-use, compact camera with lots of features that make it a really good choice for most events.  I have an iPHONE 4 and while the camera and video are handy and of good quality, I think the Fuji does a better job.  When I'm done, I just put the memory card in my Mac and store, E-mail them, post to Facebook, etc.  I found the battery life to be more than sufficient (though I bought a spare).One thing that I LOVE is that it automatically takes out the red eye.  With my Canon and my Kodak I had to depress the shutter until it beeped, so if I asked someone to take a photo of me and my wife they often did not understand this extra step and voila--lots of photos with red eye.  Sure, the Mac can fix that but I like not having to deal with it at all.I'm really happy with this camera and over the years I've owned several.  I give it five starts because it does what it says it does.  Nothing more, nothing less.

Reviews.Title: Bad Battery Cover-Love the size
Reviews.Author: Lisa Grieshop "cart"
Reviews.Content: the cover over the battery/memory card was hard to open.  The second time opening it, it broke!  Love the size, but broke already.

Reviews.Title: My new "on the run" camera.
Reviews.Author: Mark M. Kahle "MMK"
Reviews.Content: I bought this with a lot of expectations as I had owned the FinePix F20 previously.It was one of the best I'd ever owned. I have now had the JZ300 for about a month and have put it to the test. It is not as good in the shadows as the F20. I take a lot of pictures outside and seldom of people. I live in the tropics so the ability to go in and out of A/C and 100% humidity without fogging up and frying the hardware (lots of condensed moisture when going from inside to out) is important.The pictures are clean and crisp and easy to work with.... I am indeed pleased.

Reviews.Title: My 4th Fugi digital camera.
Reviews.Author: Kelly A. Harshany
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th fugi digital camera.  Just as easy to use with great quality photos.  I have two toddlers and take a ton of pics. they are usually perfectly focuses. I love the natural/flash setting that takes the photo in natural light and with flash in succession.  Then you can pick which one you like best. I love this camera just as much as i loved the other ones.

Reviews.Title: Better than ever!
Reviews.Author: Jackson Thatcher "SciFan"
Reviews.Content: This is the third FinePix camera I've owned and it continues to exceed expectations.  The 10X optical zoom adds a punch to this little pocket camera that belies its small size. Add to that the greater sensitivity of the CCD and increased MP and you've got a versatile, take everywhere camera that captures your child in the orchestra's back row with ambient lighting just as beautifully as its fast shutter speed grabs his goal making assist or your daughter's first steps.  Facial recognition, backlight and video features along with the newer high capacity SD cards leave little need to carry more equipment along.  Whether you think you a getting a gift, toy, or tool: with this little gem, no matter.  It fulfills all three roles and then some.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: Guitarfingers
Reviews.Content: I wanted to get a new camera for Christmas, because my old one had a slow zoom. I travel a lot and I love taking pictures. The zoom was so slow on that one. On this camera, it takes a few seconds and you can get a full frame shot of a person's nose even though he's across the room from you. I may not be using the camera for that, but for traveling and taking pictures of the sights, it's great!It doesn't have many different ways you can take the photo. You can have flash, no flash, you can take a picture with it'll snap two at one time, one with flash and one without. That's the only draw back for me.This camera is slim and fits into the back pocket of my jeans, or I can easily throw it into a bag and it doesn't take up much room.It's a good camera and I think anyone would like it! :]

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Danette
Reviews.Content: Love it, pics are awesome, zoom is awesome, really love the night setting that takes two pics at once (flash and no flash).

Reviews.Title: Fuji jz300
Reviews.Author: vocman
Reviews.Content: I would suggest that the manual be downloaded for this camera. It has lots of features and the manual that comes in the box is way too basic. I am very impressed with this camera for outside pictures only. Indoor shots are grainy and are a terrible disappoint.  The camera is quick in terms of recycling for the next picture and that is a positive!

Reviews.Title: great point and click
Reviews.Author: bltibbs
Reviews.Content: the camera snaps shots fairly quickly and seems to take really good photos.  It has lots of features, but not too complicated to figure out as it follows the now standard menus and symbols on most point and click cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: L. Demers
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera yesterday to sneak into a concert.  I worked awesome.  The size is small, and since I already own another FinePix camera, the buttons and options were familiar.  Needless to say I got some incredible photos, and a great video as well.  Anyone who wants a compact camera, with great photo quality,  this is the camera for you !  I got mine at Target, but it was because I needed it yesterday, and they had the best price,  same as Amazon.  Now I just need to order a case from Amazon !

Reviews.Title: An Apple of a Fuji
Reviews.Author: Spudman
Reviews.Content: Deciding on a basic point and shoot camera with just a few extras can be a trying experience. After narrowing the field to several Canon models and a Panasonic, I chose the Fuji because of positive experience with the brand, its metal body,  and mostly because of the 10x zoom. In this price range and category, the best I could find was 5x and to get the 10x feature I was willing to compromise on other features.The Fuji is a small camera, perfect for pocket, purse, or glove compartment. Finding a small generic case for this camera model is easy; we got one made by Kodak that fits better than OJ's glove.In the automatic mode the camera identifies the scene leaving the user only to decide between flash or no flash. I like the P mode which allows the user to set white balance, picture quality, and shutter speed.The scene modes are not extensive, but most of the typical modes like snow, sport, landscape,  beach, fireworks, night, flower, portrait, etc are listed in the menu. I like that on the dial are two SP settings for which the user can preset two frequently used scene modes.Picture quality for this little camera is pretty good. I own three other cameras, all costing at least twice as much as this one;  overall sharpness is better on pictures taken with the bigger cameras  but not overwhelmingly so. The pictures taken with the Fuji and enhanced with a photo program are more than acceptable. Most of the colors on the Fuji pictures are quite vivid; this can be modified on the computer, but I prefer the intense, saturated colors for most applications.Final thoughts:Image stabilization works well.Like the 10x zoom a lotTo get out of the menu settings just lightly depress the shutter buttonFace recognition works wellSmall recessed on/off button can be tricky for big fingers.Comfortable in the handSmall dial is not the easiest to turnThe Fuji JZ300 is worth considering.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera I ever had
Reviews.Author: mamabear
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera after careful  research but we are so disappointed. The camera was extremely disappointing in low light and photos that were taken w/ the zoom or in low light are unrecognizable. This is probably our 8th digital camera and the worst one we have ever had. Even outside the faces are completely washed out.. Do yourself a favor and buy a Cannon.. I will never buy Fuji again.

Reviews.Title: A handy, versitile camera
Reviews.Author: Norman R. Moulton
Reviews.Content: With an acceptable memory card, the camera works fine.  I haven't yet tried all of it's features. I like the size and on/ioff button position.

Reviews.Title: Terrible quality pictures from the get go
Reviews.Author: cassieb
Reviews.Content: We bought this as a replacement for the family digital camera that was old and outdated.  This one did not last very long at all.  Granted we do have 2 little guys, but the screen on this quit working all together within 6 months.  It was still taking picture, you just had to download the SD card to see them.  Well that lasted maybe a month and then everything started coming up white.  We are no back to the old outdated family digital camera that all though looks terrible still takes amazing pictures.  I would for sure not recommend this unless there is no chance a child would ever be near it.  Also the zoom SUCKED big time from the very get go.  The camera would get stuck with the lens out and wouldn't retract even after the camera was shut off.  We would have to remove the battery and replace it for it to retract and that was before the kids got ahold of it.  Just poor quality.

Reviews.Title: Convenient little camera, but not the best
Reviews.Author: Lori P.
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for about 3 years now.  It is an overall nice little starter camera, takes decent pictures for a point and shoot.  The video quality could be better ..... and it's not very good at taking pictures in low light situations (for example: a child's school concert where you're sitting in the middle of the auditorium, pictures are very blurry when you try to focus up on the group).  I'd recommend this for a beginner or someone who's going to take alot of posed, outside shots without much action, but if you're looking for something with more capability, this may not be the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: Good But Doesn't Last
Reviews.Author: Arch Stanton
Reviews.Content: I really liked this camera but it just didn't last like it should have. After about a month it developed a dead pixel on the viewscreen. Within three months half the screen had gone black making it difficult to see exactly what the picture looks like. After about a year the rubber came off the lens. I'm not sure precisely how long it will continue to function after this (perhaps the damage is mostly cosmetic) but I feel like the camera is on its last legs. I'll use it 'till it goes for good, but it really shouldn't be falling apart yet. I took good care of it and kept it in a nice case secure from physical damage. Certainly I used it a lot but not enough for this, and the screen damage started before I had really gotten the chance to do more than just try it out. Perhaps I simply got a defective one, but that just means that if you get this be sure to watch carefully for any problems before the warranty expires. One dead pixel isn't a problem, but a few hundred is.As for the camera itself, it's decent enough. I really liked it until it started to fall apart. Even then I was able to take my pictures no problem. As some people have noticed it doesn't take very good low-light pictures. They tend to come out very grainy. Nonetheless when I learned how to use it I took some quite exceptional nighttime shots of illuminated buildings at night. I even managed to use the zoom while propping myself against a wall (ie: no tripod) and the pictures came out perfect. I think that a lot of the negative criticisms of the camera overstate the case. While the low-light shots were grainy, they were rarely terrible. If mediocre indoor functionality of a camera is a dealbreaker then this may be a camera to avoid, but otherwise it isn't a major problem. I took most of my photos during the day in any event, and they came out beautiful. No grain at all and very crisp.The battery life is alright. I wish that cameras like this could just take AA batteries when your main one dies, but I guess that that isn't gonna happen. I ended up buying a spare battery and even being an atrocious shutterbug the two batteries lasted me all day. I'm not that familiar with digital cameras (my last camera was a 30mm SLR) so I can't say whether that's good or not. All that I know is that it was adequate for my needs. The only time I had a problem was when I accidentally left my charger at home while I was in the middle of the Jordanian desert. I actually had more of a problem with the SDHC Cards. The 4 GB one that the camera comes with just doesn't cut it. You are going to need to buy a bigger one at some point.You can actually do a surprising amount with this camera for just a simple point-and-shoot. The zoom is amazing for its size. I don't think that any of the models of comparable price can compete with a 10x zoom. The various settings take a little while to figure out, but once you get them sorted you can take very good pics. Obviously this can't compete with a more advanced camera, but then few of those can fit in your pocket and none of them are cheap. All in all this isn't a bad camera for basic shots, provided that you get one that isn't defective. If mine hadn't fallen apart I'd have undoubtedly given it five stars.

Reviews.Title: Camera charger little tricky
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: I asked the seller a product question, took sometime to reply and referred me to contact the manufacturer. The camera charger could be a little tricky; make sure to plug it in the right dimensional area.

Reviews.Title: Best pocket camera I've had, but...
Reviews.Author: B. J. Larkin
Reviews.Content: I like *almost* everything about my Fujifilm JA300. I've had it for six month, and have taken a couple of thousand pictures. Most important to me, the images are sharp and the colors are realistic.Except for one annoyance, I would give this camera a 5-Star rating: the battery/digital card cover design.Instead of sliding, the card and battery cover now flips up with the long-side hinged lengthwise with the camera body. This may be work for fine-fingered people, but for those of us who wear large size gloves, it is devilishly awkward trying to get the card out.This is not a deal-breaker, mainly because my Fujifilm JZ300 gives me the sharpest pictures of any similar camera I've ever had. But the battery-card cover design does take one star off a top rating.

Reviews.Title: A Great Little Camera - that breaks
Reviews.Author: Jean
Reviews.Content: I've got to say that I am very disappointed to be giving this camera a bad review.  I really like the camera but the first one I received had a focus error.  You would have to turn the camera off and on again to make it go away. Then it functioned just fine.  Amazon was nice enough to take it back even though it was outside the return window.  I explained that it was a gift so my husband had it in an unopened box for two months before I received it.They took it back and I reordered.I have had this camera just over a month and today I turned it on to see the display is malfunctioning.  Did you catch the "just over a month" part?  That's right.  It's 3 days outside the return window.  I just emailed Amazon about it and I'm beginning research on a new camera in the same price range.Super disappointed.  I've always liked the Fuji Finepix line.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Stefanie L. Stanek
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera from the time I got it.  It has great settings and takes very good pictures and love the zoom.  Also good videos.  My baby girl grabbed mine with a wet sandy hand and I just ordered the exact same one.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: GloryDav
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my first vacation with this camera and I am very pleased with its performance. From stellar sunsets, to pristine beaches, to spectacular fireworks...all of my pics were amazing and I have wonderful treasures of my vacation thanks to this camera. The zoom feature is easy to operate and provides great detail. I was able to zoom in on things that I could not see with my naked eye.

Reviews.Title: Terrific Camera
Reviews.Author: gypsy
Reviews.Content: I lost my camera while traveling and ordered the Fuji FinePix JZ300.  I have had it a year now and it has become my favorite camera.

Reviews.Title: Thin, excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Snowbunny
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera! I wanted something that was thin enough for me to put in my pocket, yet powerful enough to take great shots. I'm a dancer in college, so I need something that can take shots of performers, as well as great shots at parties and this camera is amazing. all the settings are wonderful. The zoom is great seeing as how the camera lens doesn't pop out of the body of the camera like with other cameras.

Reviews.Title: Good digital for the buck
Reviews.Author: Carol V. Stanger
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to this camera because of the 10x zoom feature.  The manual which had to be printed did not give much information as to taking photos at a distance inside (i.e., concerts).  I'm working this one out on my own.  They could upgrade the instruction manual.  Thus far, the close up photos have been great.

Reviews.Title: Out of Focus
Reviews.Author: Mark Chevy
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Fuji JZ300 for the 10x zoom and the HD video with zoom. I purchases this camera to replace my 6 year old but still working and trusty Fuji E550. I quickly realized that the JZ300 has a hard time focusing. Many, if not most of the test pictures I took were out of focus. The ones that were in focus were pretty good, but this was only about 25% of the pictures. Not only that, but you just cannot see the viewing screen in bright sunlight. This makes the camera very unpleasant to use outside. I sent this camera back for a Canon A3300 - which has its own issues. The bottom line, my E550 with 6MP, 2" screen, 4X zoom and 640P video is a better camera than the JZ300.

Reviews.Title: Horrible camera
Reviews.Author: Sabrina L. Baker-McQuay
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my Casio Exilim camera because sadly it broke after 4 years. I read all the reviews and thought that this Fujifilm camera would be awesome for the price, sadly I was wrong.The quality of the picture is horrible. Almost all the picture I took where out of focus. I took several pictures of the exact same thing like 10 times in order to get one decent shot. Don't get me wrong it takes a few decent up close pictures but if you are trying to take a picture of anything far away, like say 10 feet away, don't expect the flash/zoom to help, odds are the photo is going to be blurry. Even all the different setting that are on the camera are horrible. They don't do anything noticeable other then the smooth portrait face option. That's the only setting that's noticeably different when you use it.When I tried recording a video it was great but 2 minutes into my video I had white lines going across the screen!I think I'm going to end up re-selling my camera and buying a different kind or maybe just buy another Casio Exilim. I'm NOT happy with this camera at all!

Reviews.Title: Pictures are Blurry and the Seller is Not Nice
Reviews.Author: ItemReview
Reviews.Content: Not alot of settings on this camera , The colors are distorted , the camera is heavy , the baterry has a very very short life span.

Reviews.Title: Beware the limitations
Reviews.Author: OCNP "EAS"
Reviews.Content: I have another Fugi camera that I took to Africa and I love it but it is bulky and heavy to carry in my purse.  I wanted something to have with me all the time.  I made the mistake of not taking my Fugi with 18x zoom to Alaska.  It also has a view finder.  This camera has no view finder other than the large LCD viewer that is worthless outside in bright light, especially when trying to catch a whale breach.  I have had the camera 7 months and I am having major problems with it.  The first month I had the disaster of the battery running out in the middle of a graduation ceremony.  I bought an extra battery.  The camera eats up battery if you use the SRauto feature.  I learned this after I downloaded the full instructions from  the internet.  It was not in the instruction booklet that comes with the camera.  It did take great HD movies on the Alaska trip.  It is great at quilt shows.  At month 4, the camera lens covers stopped opening completely when turning the camera on.  I did not notice at first (outside shots in bright light) but my son called my attention to it.  Now the camera on/off switch blinks intermittently running down the battery when the camera is unopened and not in use.  I did solve the problem of the camera not starting up when the phone trouble shooter told me how to reboot the camera.  I would not advise purchasing this device.

Reviews.Title: WORST CAMERA - DO NOT EVER BUY A FUJI CAMERA
Reviews.Author: JF
Reviews.Content: I would have given this camera zero stars if I could!!!  This camera takes the worst photos.  DO NOT BUY THIS FUJI CAMERA.  I seriously thought my camera was defective and corresponded with FUJI representatives via emails as they kept saying the setting I have on the ISO was wrong.  It didn't matter what setting it was on - every photo I took indoors was grainy, blurry, and if the flash was used, the photos were still very dark-completely worthless.  Outdoors, the photos were a bit better due to the natural light but overall, the photos were still grainy regardless of the setting of the camera.  When I asked for my money back, FUJI refused so now I am stuck with a $160 camera that should be thrown in the trash.  SAVE YOUR MONEY and buy a Nikon Coolpix.  I had a Nikon Coolpix prior to buying this FUJI (because the salespersons at J&R; talked me into it) for less money and the photo quality was probably about 20 times better. Save yourself any frustration and buy a different brand.

Reviews.Title: My Comments-Dark and Blurry Like this Camera
Reviews.Author: Jerzie Doll
Reviews.Content: To make a long story short, blurry, dark, grainy, and seems to pick up all the white. Terrible outdoor, beyond terrible indoor. SAD.

ProductInfo.Features:
12-megapixel, 1/2.3-inch CCD for photo-quality poster-sized prints
10x wide-angle optical zoom (28mm-280mm equivalent); dual image stabilization
Capture movies in 720p with sound
Tracking Auto Focus
Face Detection and Automatic Red-eye Removal
ProductInfo.Name: Fujifilm FinePix JZ300 12 MP Digital Camera with 10x Wide Angle Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Black)
